text: Hammam Essalihine ( Ḥammām aṣ-Ṣāliḥīn, lit. "The Bath of the Righteous"; ) is an ancient Roman Bath situated in the Aurès Mountains in the El Hamma District in the Khenchela Province of Algeria. As the Latin name suggests, it dates from the time of the Flavian Dynasty. ==See also== * List of Roman public baths Category:Archaeological sites in Algeria Category:Ancient Roman baths Category:Former populated places in Algeria Category:Buildings and structures in Khenchela Province Category:Buildings and structures completed in the 1st century
title: Hammam Essalihine
